description.en: The course will combine international perspective to migration with the local demographic processes, and place European and Estonian urban trends within the context of the global urbanization. The main migration and demographic approaches and concepts will be discussed: types of migration and intra-urban residential mobility,  socio-economic and ethnic segregation, lifecourse theories, transnationalism. Practical exercises and discussions will be carried out during the course, with an aim to develop students' analytical skills and capabilities to independently carry out fieldwork in the field of urban geography. Different pedagogic methods will be applied to combine individual exercises with teamwork, discussion seminars with lectures. During the course meetings will be organized with the key persons among Estonian urban and immigration policy implementors. In this way students will be able to combine theoretical knowldedge with the practical outputs. The course will partly be carried out in combination with a related course "Demography and Urban Social Geography" (4EAP, LOOM.02.341) within the Master programmes in the field of human geography. The mix of students with different backgrounds in both courses provides added value to the study outputs.
description.et:
Kursuse raames seotakse rahvusvahelise rände makroperspektiiv lokaalsete rahvastiku- ja linna arengu protsessidega ning paigutatakse Euroopa ja Eesti linnade trendid globaalsesse linnastumise konteksti. Käsitletakse järgmisi rände ja demograafia lähenemisi ja põhikontseptsioone: erinevad rände- ja elukohamobiilsuse tüübid, sotsiaalmajanduslik ja etniline segregatsioon, elukaare teooriad, hargmaisus. Aine käigus viiakse läbi praktilisi harjutusi ja arutelusid, mille eesmärk on arendada üliõpilaste analüüsioskusi ja võimet iseseisvalt läbi viia linnageograafilisi uurimistöid. Rakendatakse erinevaid pedagoogilisi võtteid, kombineerides individuaalseid töid meeskonnatööga, aruteluseminare loengutega. Kursuse käigus kohtutakse Eestis linnapoliitikaid kujundavate ja pagulaste integreerumist korraldavate võtmeisikutega, tugevdades nii üliõpilaste võimet siduda teoreetilisi teadmisi praktiliste väljunditega.
Õppeaine põhiosa (4EAP) õpetatakse koos TÜ geograafia osakonna eestikeelse magistriõppekava ja ingliskeelse magistriõppekava "GIS in urbanized society" tudengitele (aine "Demography and Urban Social Geography", 4EAP, LOOM.02.341). Selliselt osalevad aines väga erineva geograafilise tausta ja linnalise kogemusega tudengid.

objectives.en: The aim is to get overview of the global population trends and their relationship to urban development and planning
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on anda ülevaade globaalsetest rahvastikutrendidest ja nende seostest linnade arengu ja planeerimisega.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student will
1) understand the development of global population trends in different regions of the globe;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) saab aru, kuidas kujuneb linnade rahvastik erinevates maailma regioonides;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) understand the relationship between migration, social inequalities and urban spatial segregation;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) saab aru, kuidas on omavahel seotud ränne, sotsiaalne ebavõrdsus ja ruumiline segregatsioon;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) know the main concepts in demography, migration and segregation
learning_outcomes.et: 3) valdab demograafia, rände ja segregatsiooni valdkonna põhikontseptsioone;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) obtain analytical skills in the field, including composing population forecast, measure segregation and evaluate life quality in urban neighbourhoods;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) omab valdkonna analüütilisi oskusi, sh oskab koostada rahvastikuprognoose, mõõta segregatsiooni ning hinnata linnanaabruskondade elukvaliteeti.

learning_outcomes.en: 5) reflect on the differences and common values shaping migrant integration across cultures and societies
learning_outcomes.et: 5) oskab arutleda erinevuste ja sarnaste väärtuste üle erinevates kultuurides ja ühiskondades

learning_outcomes.en: 6) be able to place Estonia and Europe among the global framework of urbanization and migration trends;
learning_outcomes.et: 6) oskab paigutada Eesti ja Euroopa eri regioonide linnade arengu globaalsesse linnastumise ja rändevõrgustike konteksti, sh oskab eristada erinevaid rahvusvahelisi rändevooge ja mõistab nende mõju linnadele;

learning_outcomes.en: 7) obtain practical knowledge on urban and migration policy.
learning_outcomes.et: 7) on saanud praktilisi teadmisi linnapoliitikate ja rändepoliitika kujundamisest.

independent_work.et:
Three home assignments are done in groups of 4. Urban essay is done individually. 
Home assignment 1 (group work): Population projection 
Home assignment 2 (group work): Segragation analyses
Home assignment 3 (group work): Gentrification
Home assignment 4 (individual work): Urban essay
Detailed instructions will be published in Moodle.

description.et:
Criteria for evaluation:
Originality, ability to use reading materials for particular empirical context,  ability to apply various social research methods for studying urban processes, ability of critical thinking and producing constructive creative ideas, technical competences.

The contribution of all group members into the final project will be assessed. All members are expected to have more or less equal contribution to the project, as well as in the preparation of presentations during the seminars. The contributions of all team members can be assessed differently.

Students are expected to have an overview of the course material and topics discussed in lectures and seminars.
The exam will take place in Moodle.

grade_evaluation.et:
100% of the final grade consists of:
Home assignment 1 - 10%
Home assignment 2 - 10%
Home assignment 3 - 10%
Home assignment 4 - 20%
Final exam - 50%

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with the course leaders.
